summary: This is an email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York (SDNY) providing an update on the Epstein investigation. It discusses coordination with the Southern District of Florida (SDFL) U.S. Attorney's Office, which is walled off due to conflicts from the prior non-prosecution agreement and an ongoing civil lawsuit. The email also mentions plans to contact victim attorneys.

persons.name: Marlier
persons.context: Mentioned as someone the recipient spoke with about the ODAG authorization and investigation to-do list, including contacting Florida agents.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The sender of the email, updating on the status of the Epstein investigation, coordination with SDFL, and plans to contact victim attorneys.

persons.name: Criminal Division chief
persons.context: Reached out to the Southern District of Florida (SDFL) on behalf of the SDNY investigation to discuss access to Florida investigative materials.

persons.name: SDFL criminal chief
persons.role: Criminal Chief, U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida
persons.context: Acknowledged the SDNY investigation and stated the SDFL office is fully conflicted and walled off from any Epstein-related investigation due to the prior non-prosecution agreement and ongoing lawsuit.

connections.person1: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.description: The AUSA mentions that 'we asked our Criminal Division chief to reach out to SDFL', indicating a supervisory or collaborative working relationship within the SDNY U.S. Attorney's Office.
The SDNY Criminal Division chief called the SDFL criminal chief to advise them of the SDNY's active investigation and discuss access to Florida FBI materials.

connections.person1: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.description: The email indicates the recipient had spoken with Marlier earlier the same day about investigation authorizations and priorities.

events.title: SDNY-SDFL Coordination on Epstein Investigation
events.description: The SDNY U.S. Attorney's Office coordinates with the SDFL U.S. Attorney's Office, which declares itself fully conflicted and walled off from the Epstein investigation due to the prior non-prosecution agreement and an ongoing civil lawsuit.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

events.title: SDNY Investigation Authorization and Outreach
events.description: The SDNY has received ODAG authorization to move forward with its Epstein investigation and is beginning to carefully reach out to victim attorneys.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

keyFacts: The SDNY had an active criminal investigation into Jeffrey Epstein as of December 2018, authorized by the Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG).

The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida (SDFL) considered itself 'fully conflicted and walled off' from any Epstein investigation due to its prior role in the non-prosecution agreement and an ongoing civil lawsuit seeking to overturn that agreement.
SDNY investigators were instructed to avoid contact with SDFL line assistants and any Florida agents who had been involved in the civil lawsuit (e.g., deposed or subpoenaed) to prevent conflicts.
The SDNY planned to obtain investigative materials from Florida FBI agents and to begin contacting attorneys for victims.
